developerResponse:
{'id': 24713074, 'body': "UPD: We took into account the comment about the overlaid text and fixed this in the following release. This release is now available for update. We always take into account the feedback and suggestions from our users to make the app better and bring even more value to all our users.  Best Wishes, Stress Monitor Team.      \xa0

First Developer response:\xa0
Hello, Thank you for sharing your feedback. That helps us to make the app better for our users.

Let us provide some clarifications about the mentioned points.
New features in the recent update:
In this update, we have added a new Body Feedback Score. It includes more variables and allows you more accurately assess your condition, both physical and mental. It considers such data as HRV and very important Resting Heart Rate. The HRV Score that was available in the previous app version is also available in the app. You can see it on your Apple Watch, and you can also see it in the app on the main tab. You can consider it separately and as a contributor to the Body Feedback Score.

Enlarged font:
It is very important for us to make the app easy to use for all our users. We‚Äôll carefully check in the upcoming updates that all the descriptions are easy to read with the enlarged fonts.

The bar chart correlation with the main:
The scores on the main tab are averages for today. By swiping down the screen, you‚Äôll see the detailed measurements for today and the hrv scores for that individual measurements. 
The heatmap has a division by hours. The color of the cell reflects the average data for that hour. If you have a few measurements per hour - the color of the sell will show an average data. 

We‚Äôll take into account your feedback and think about how we can make the app better for all our users. If you have any other questions, please, always feel free to contact us at dev@activeace.app. We'll be happy to help.

Best Wishes, 
Elena from Stress Monitor Team.", 'modified': '2021-08-25T13:02:05Z'}
review:
Since a recent upgrade, this app is not as good as it used to be. 

Instead of the simple gui in the watch, there's now three disks to look at. However, it seems that because I have bigger type settings as standard, text is overlaid and unreadable. 

The bar charts a few also unhelpful and don't really with the main screen. I want it back like it was.
title: Not what it was.

If you want to reduce stress- don‚Äôt look for help with this app!
